Key Arguments: The legislation is an attack on free speech and democratic principles.
Social media should be treated as a utility that facilitates free speech.
The legislation will harm independent news sources and citizen journalists.
There is a lack of clarity on what constitutes harm, leading to potential abuse.
The legislation could lead to intense surveillance and politically motivated actions.
Government and its proxies will be exempt, creating an imbalance in authority.
The legislation could criminalize dissenting opinions and stifle debate.
Existing laws already address discrimination and harm, making new laws unnecessary.

The legislation will be literally a kill-bill for the plethora of voices that should have a right to free speech.
This legislation, therefore, is control by government on free speech and is complete overreach.
Free speech is a human right. Freedom of speech means freedom for those who you despise, and freedom to express the most despicable views.
